soften.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to become less hard or rough, or make something less hard or rough
soften.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Use moisturizer to soften your skin.
soften.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if your attitude softens, or if something softens it, it becomes less strict and more sympathetic
soften.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The government has softened its stance on public spending.
I felt that he was beginning to soften towards me.
soften.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to make the effect of something seem less unpleasant or severe, or to become less unpleasant or severe
soften.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The impact of the tax was softened by large tax-free allowances.
soften.translation[0].definitions[3].def: if your expression or voice softens, or if something softens it, you look or sound kinder and more gentle
soften.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: His voice softened as he spoke to her.
soften.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to make the shape or colour of something look less severe
soften.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Climbing plants soften the outline of a fence.
